author.organization: Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers

abstract.t: This document specifies the format and contents of Data Escrow deposits for the standard set of Registry objects including domain, host, contact, registrar, IDN language rules, and EPP parameters (mappings, extensions, data collection policy).

section.title: Introduction
section.t: The Registry Data Escrow Specification can be extended to support any type of object that is included in a data escrow. This document defines the data escrow structure of the standard set of objects for a Domain Name Registry which include:

list.t: Internet domain names that are typically provisioned in a Domain Name Registry using the EPP domain name mapping. The attributes defined in the EPP domain name mapping are fully supported by this document.
Internet host names that are typically provisioned in a Domain Name Registry using the EPP host mapping. The attributes defined in the EPP host mapping are fully supported by this document.

Individual or organization social information provisioned in a Domain Name Registry using the EPP contact mapping. The attributes defined in the EPP contact mapping are fully supported by this document.
The organization that sponsors objects like domains, hosts, and contacts in a Domain Name Registry. The Registrar MAY also be associated with contacts, referred to as Registrars contacts.
Internationalized Domain Names (IDN) included in the Domain Object Data Escrow include references to the languages rules that define the set of character code points allowed for a specific language.
Each Domain Name Registry supports a set of EPP object mappings, EPP extensions, and data collection policy (DCP).

section.title: Models
section.t: This document defines two different models that can be used to deposit data escrow objects that follow the structure defined in the Registry Data Escrow Specification. The models include:

list.t: The XML model includes all of the deposit information (meta-data and data) in an XML document. The definition of the XML format is fully defined in the XML schemas. This model is appropriate for small to medium sized registries that can fully validate the data escrow deposit using a standard validation XML parser.

The CSV model uses XML to define the data escrow format of the data contained in referenced Comma-Seperated Values (CSV) files. This model is appropriate for medium to large sized registries that will be overly expensive to generate and validate a large data escrow deposit. This model MAY also be used where it is more cost effective to generate and consume the CSV data from and to a database.

section.t: The data escrow file MAY contain a mix of both models but SHOULD contain a single model.

section.title: Conventions Used in This Document
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

section.title: Date and Time
section.t: Numerous fields indicate "dates", such as the creation and expiry dates for domains. These fields SHALL contain timestamps indicating the date and time in UTC as specified in , with no offset from the zero meridian.

section.title: Country names
section.t: Country identifiers SHALL be represented using two character identifiers as specified in .

section.title: Telephone numbers
section.t: Telephone numbers (both voice and fax) SHALL be formatted based on structures defined in . Telephone numbers described in this specification are character strings that MUST begin with a plus sign ("+", ASCII value 0x002B), followed by a country code defined in , followed by a dot (".", ASCII value 0x002E), followed by a sequence of digits representing the telephone number.

section.title: Internationalized and Localized Elements
section.t: Some elements MAY be provided in either internationalized form ("int") or provided in localized form ("loc"). Those elements use a "type" or "isLoc" attribute to specify the form used. If an "isLoc" attribute is used, a value of "true" indicates the use of the localized form and a value of "false" indicates the use of the internationalized form. This MAY override the form specified for a parent element. A "type" attribute value of "int" is used to indicate the internationalized form and a value of "loc" is used to indicate the localized form. When the internalized form ("int") is provided, the element value MUST be represented in a subset of UTF-8 that can be represented in the 7-bit US-ASCII character set. When the localized form ("loc") is provided, the element value MAY be represented in unrestricted UTF-8. The <rdeContact:postalInfo> element below is an example of an internationalized element:

section.title: IP addresses
section.t: IP addresses syntax MUST conform either to, Internet Protocol , for IPv4 addresses, or IP Version 6 Addressing Architecture , for IPv6 addresses.

section.title: <rdeCsv:csv> and <rdeCsv:csvDelete> elements
section.t: To support a CSV model with the Registry Data Escrow Specification, a <rdeCsv:csv> element is defined that substitutes for <rde:content> as a child element of a <rde:contents> substitute element like the <rdeDomain:contents> element. A <rdeCsv:csvDelete> element substitutes for <rde:delete> as a child element of the <rde:deletes> element. The <rdeCsv:csv> and <rdeCsv:csvDelete> elements share the following child elements:

list.t: Optional definition of the CSV separator characters with the default separator character of ",".

Ordered list of CSV fields used in the CSV files. There is one or more child elements that substitute for the <rdeCsv:field> abstract element. Each element defines the format of the CSV field contained in the CSV files. <rdeCsv:field> elements by convention support the "type" attribute that defines the XML data type of the field elements, an optional "list" attribute that when "true" indicates that the field is a list with the list elements type defined by the "type" attribute, and an optional "sep" attribute for list fields that defines the list element separator characters with a default seperator of ','. List fields MUST be enclosed in double quotes '"'. By convention all fields are optional, where an undefined field can be represented with an empty field value ",," in the CSV file, where ',' is the seperator character.
A list of one or more CSV files using the <rdeCsv:file> child element. The <rdeCsv:file> child element defines a reference to the CSV file name and has the following optional attributes:
If the CSV file is compressed, the "compression" attribute defines the compression format like "gzip" or "zip".
Defines the encoding of the CSV file with the default encoding of "UTF-8".
Defines the checksum CRC (UNIX cksum) of the CSV file. This attribute is used to validate that the full CSV file exists and has not been tampered with.

section.t: The <rdeCsv:csv> and <rdeCsv:csvDelete> elements requires a "name" attribute that defines the purpose of the CSV file with values like "domain", "host", "contact". The supported "name" attribute values are defined for each object type.
The following is an example of the <rdeCsv:csv> element for domain name records.
The following is example of the "domain-YYYYMMDD.csv" file with a single record matching the <rdeCsv:fields> definition.
The following is an example of the <rde:csvDelete> element for domain name records.
The following is example of the "domain-delete-YYYYMMDD.csv" file with a single record and matching the single <rdeCsv:fName> field.

section.title: CSV common field elements
section.t: The <rdeCsv:fields> element defined in the <rdeCsv:csv> and <rdeCsv:csvDelete> elements section has child elements that substitute for the abstract <rdeCsv:field> element. By convention <rdeCsv:field> elements incude an 'f' prefix to identify it as a field definition element. There are a set of common field elements that are used across multiple data escrow objects. The common field elements are defined using the "urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeCsv-1.0" namespace and using the "rdeCsv" sample namespace prefix. The CSV common field elements include:

list.t: Name field with type="eppcom:labelType".
UTF-8 encoded name field with type="eppcom:labelType".
Repository Object IDentifier (ROID) field with type="eppcom:roidType".
Registrant contact identifier with type="eppcom:clIDType".
List of administration contact identifiers with the list elements type="eppcom:clIDType".
List of technical contact identifiers with the list elements type="eppcom:clIDType".
List of billing contact identifiers with the list elements type="eppcom:clIDType".
List of statuses with the list element type="eppcom:statusType".
Identifier of client that sponsors the object with type="eppcom:clIDType".
Identifier of client that created the object with type="eppcom:clIDType".
Identifier of client that updated the object with type="eppcom:clIDType".
Identifier of client that requested the transfer with type="eppcom:clIDType".
Identifier of client that should take or took action for transfer with type="eppcom:clIDType".
Created date of object with type="datetime".
Updated date of object with type="datetime".
Expiration date of object with type="datetime".
Date that transfer was requested with type="datetime".
Date that transfer action should be taken or has been taken with type="datetime".
Date of last transfer with type="datetime".
State of the most recent transfer request with type="eppcom:trStatusType".
General token field with type="token".
General language field with type="language".
General positive integer field with type="positiveInteger".
Password authorization info value with type="normalizedString".
Custom field with name attribute that defines the custom field name" with type="token".

section.title: Protocol Description
section.t: The following is a format for Data Escrow deposits for the standard set of objects of a Domain Name Registry. Format elements are reused from the EPP and related RFCs.

section.title: Domain Name Object
section.t: The domain name object is based on the EPP domain name mapping in . The domain name object supports both the XML Model and the CSV Model, defined in the Models section. The elements used for both models are defined in the following sections. Both models use the <rdeDomain:contents> child element of the <rde:contents> element to hold the domain name objects for the deposit.

section.title: XML Model
section.t: There are two elements used in the data escrow of the domain name objects for the XML model including the <rdeDomain:domain>, under the <rdeDomain:contents> element, and the <rdeDomain:delete> element, under the <rde:deletes> element.

section.title: <rdeDomain:domain> element
section.t: The <rdeDomain:domain> element is based the EPP Domain Name Mapping for both the domain name object information and domain name transfer information. The DNSSEC information is based on the EPP DNSSSEC Extension. The <rdeDomain:domain> element contains the following child elements:

list.t: Contains the fully qualified name of the domain name object.
An OPTIONAL UTF-8 encoded fully qualified name of the IDN domain name object.
Contains the Repository Object IDentifier assigned to the domain name object when the object was created.
An OPTIONAL boolean flag indicating if the domain name object is an IDN domain name object.
An OPTIONAL language tag value for an IDN domain name object. The language tag value MUST be one of the <rdeIDN:language> elements contained in an <rdeIDN:languageRules> element, described in .

An OPTIONAL boolean flag indicating if the domain name object is an IDN variant domain name object. If the <rdeDomain:variant> value is "true" the <rdeDomain:originalName> SHOULD be set with the original IDN domain name object.
An OPTIONAL fully qualified name of the original IDN domain name object related to the variant domain name object. This value SHOULD be set if <rdeDomain:variant> is "true".

An OPTIONAL boolean flag indicating if the domain name object is a reserved domain name object. A reserved domain name object is not registered by a client but by the server to ensure that it can't be registered by a client.
Zero or more OPTIONAL <rdeDomain:status> elements that contain the current status descriptors associated with the domain name object using the status values defined in .

Zero or more OPTIONAL <rdeDomain:rgpStatus> elements that contain the current Registry Grace Period (RGP) status descriptors associated with the domain name object using the status values defined in .
An OPTIONAL registrant contact identifier associated with the domain name object.
Zero or more OPTIONAL <rdeDomain:contact> elements that contain the contact identifiers and the contact types as defined in associated with the domain name object.

An OPTIONAL element that contains the fully qualified names of the delegated host objects or host attributes (name servers) associated with the domain name object. Refer to section 1.1 of for a description of the elements used to specify host objects or host attributes.
Zero or more OPTIONAL <rdeDomain:host> elements that contain the fully qualified names of the subordinate host objects that exist under this superordinate domain name object.
Contains the identifier of the sponsoring client.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the identifier of the client that created the domain name object.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of domain name object creation.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time identifying the end of the domain object's registration period.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the identifier of the client that last updated the domain name object.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of the most recent domain-object modification.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of the most recent domain-object transfer.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the authorization information associated with the domain name object per .
An OPTIONAL element containing the DNSSEC information associated with the domain name object per .
Zero or more optional <rdeDomain:transfer> elements that contain the information of pending transfer and completed transfer requests.
An OPTIONAL element containing the custom domain name object attribute extensions.

section.t: Example of a <rdeDomain:domain> element:

section.title: <rdeDomain:delete> object
section.t: The <rdeDomain:delete> is contained under the <rde:deletes> element to define the list of domain name objects that have been deleted in a differential (DIFF) or incremental (INCR) deposit. The <rdeDomain:delete> element contains the following child elements:

list.t: Zero or more <rdeDomain:name> elements that contain the fully qualified names of the deleted domain name objects.

section.t: Example of a <rdeDomain:delete> element:

section.t: For the CSV Model of the domain name object, the <rdeCsv:csv> and the <rdeCsv:csvDelete> elements, defined in the "<rdeCsv:csv> and <rdeCsv:csvDelete> elements" section, are used with the following supported "name" attribute values:

list.t: Defines the fields and CSV file references used for the domain name object records. The following field elements were added for use in the "domain" <rdeCsv:csv> <rdeCsv:fields> element:
Boolean flag indicating if the domain name object is an IDN domain name object with type="boolean".
Boolean flag indicating if the domain name object is an IDN variant domain name object with type="boolean".
Fully qualified name of the original IDN domain name object related to the variant domain name object with type="eppcom:labelType".
Boolean flag indicating if the domain name object is a reserved domain with type="boolean".
List of Registry Grace Period (RGP) status descriptors with the list elements type="rgp:statusType" as defined in .
List of fully qualified names of the delegated host objects associated with the domain name object with the list elements type="eppcom:labelType".

Indicates a child's preference for the number of seconds after signature generation when the parent's signature on the DS information provided by the child will expire with type="secDNS:maxSigLifeType" defined in .
Contains the DS key tag value per with type="unsignedShort".
Contains the DS algorithm value per with type="unsignedByte".
Contains the DS digest type value per with type="unsignedByte".
Contains the DS digest value per with type="hexBinary".
Contains the flags field value per with type="unsignedShort".
Contains the Key protocol value per with type="unsignedByte".
Contains the Key algorithm value per with type="unsignedByte".
Contains the public key value per with type="secDNS:keyType".

section.title: Host Object
section.t: The host object is based on the EPP host mapping in . The host object supports both the XML Model and the CSV Model, defined in Models section. The elements used for both models are defined in the following sections. Both models use the <rdeHost:contents> child element of the <rde:contents> element to hold the host objects for the deposit.

section.title: XML Model
section.t: There are two elements used in the data escrow of the host objects for the XML model including the <rdeHost:host>, under the <rdeHost:contents> element, and the <rdeHost:delete> element, under the <rde:deletes> element.

section.title: <rdeHost:host> element
section.t: The <rdeHost:host> element is based the EPP Host Mapping for the host object information. The <rdeHost:host> element contains the following child elements:

list.t: Contains the fully qualified name of the host object.
An OPTIONAL UTF-8 encoded fully qualified name of the IDN host object.
An OPTIONAL parent domain name for the subordinate host object.
Contains the Repository Object IDentifier assigned to the host object when the object was created.
An OPTIONAL boolean flag indicating if the host object is an IDN host object.
Zero or more OPTIONAL <rdeHost:status> elements that contain the current status descriptors associated with the host object using the status values defined in .
Zero or more OPTIONAL <rdeHost:addr> elements that contain the IP addresses associated with the host object.
Contains the identifier of the sponsoring client.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the identifier of the client that created the host object.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of host object creation.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the identifier of the client that last updated the host object.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of the most recent host object modification.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of the most recent host object transfer.
An OPTIONAL element containing the custom host object attribute extensions.

section.t: Example of a <rdeHost:host> element for an sub-ordinate host object:
Example of a <rdeHost:host> element for an external host object:

section.title: <rdeHost:delete> object
section.t: The <rdeHost:delete> is contained under the <rde:deletes> element to define the list of host objects that have been deleted in a differential (DIFF) or incremental (INCR) deposit. The <rdeHost:delete> element contains the following child elements:

list.t: Zero or more <rdeHost:name> elements that contain the fully qualified names of the deleted host objects.

section.t: Example of a <rdeHost:delete> element:

section.title: CSV Model
section.t: For the CSV Model of the host object, the <rdeCsv:csv> and the <rdeCsv:csvDelete> elements, defined in the "<rdeCsv:csv> and <rdeCsv:csvDelete> elements" section, are used with the following supported "name" attribute values:

list.t: Defines the fields and CSV file references used for the host object records. The following field elements were added for use in the "host" <rdeCsv:csv> <rdeCsv:fields> element:
Contains parent domain name for the subordinate host object with type="eppcom:labelType".
Boolean flag indicating if the host object is an IDN host object with type="boolean".
List of IPv4 IP addresses for the host object with the list elements type="host:addrStringType".
List of IPv6 IP addresses for the host object with the list elements type="host:addrStringType".
The following "rdeCsv" fields, defined in section CSV common field elements, MAY be used in the "host" <rdeCsv:csv> and <rdeCsv:csvDelete< rdeCsv:fields> elements:
<rdeCsv:fName>
<rdeCsv:fUName>
<rdeCsv:fRoid>
<rdeCsv:fStatuses>
<rdeCsv:fClID>
<rdeCsv:fCrID>
<rdeCsv:fCrDate>
<rdeCsv:fUpID>
<rdeCsv:fUpDate>
<rdeCsv:fTrDate>

section.title: Contact Object
section.t: The contact object is based on the EPP contact mapping in . The contact object supports both the XML Model and the CSV Model, defined in Models section. The elements used for both models are defined in the following sections. Both models use the <rdeContact:contents> child element of the <rde:contents> element to hold the contact objects for the deposit.

section.title: XML Model
section.t: There are two elements used in the data escrow of the contact objects for the XML model including the <rdeContact:contact>, under the <rdeContact:contents> element, and the <rdeContact:delete> element, under the <rde:deletes> element.

section.title: <rdeContact:contact> element
section.t: The <rdeContact:contact> element is based the EPP Contact Mapping for the contact object information. The <rdeContact:contact> element contains the following child elements:

list.t: Contains the server-unique identifier of the contact object.
Contains the Repository Object IDentifier assigned to the contact object when the object was created.
Zero or more OPTIONAL <rdeContact:status> elements that contain the current status descriptors associated with the contact object using the status values defined in .

One or two <rdeContact:postalInfo> elements that contain the postal-address informaton associated with the contact object based on what is defined in . Two elements are provided so that address information can be provided in both internationlized and localized forms; a "type" attribute is used to identify the two forms. If an internationalized form (type"int") is provided, the element content MUST be represented in a subset of UTF-8 that can be represented in the 7-bit US-ASCII character set. If a localized form (type="loc") is provided, element content MAY be represented in unrestricted UTF-8. The <rdeContact:postalInfo> has the same child elements as the <contact:postalInfo> element, which include:
Contains the name of the individual or role represented by the contact.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the name of the organization with which the contact is affiliated.
Contains address information associated with the contact object. A <contact:addr> element contains the following child elements:
One, two, or three OPTIONAL <contact:street> elements that contact the contact's street address.
Contains the contact's city.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the contact's state or province.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the contact's postal code.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the contact's country code.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the contact's voice telephone number.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the contact's facsimile telephone number.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the contact's email address.
Contains the identifier of the sponsoring client.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the identifier of the client that created the contact object.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of contact object creation.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the identifier of the client that last updated the contact object.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of the most recent contact object modification.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of the most recent successful contact-object transfer.
Contains the authorization information associated with the contact object per .

An OPTIONAL element that identifies elements that require exceptoinal server-operator handling to allow or restrict disclosure to third parties. See section 2.9 of for a description of the child elements contained within the <rdeContact:disclose> element.
An OPTIONAL element containing the custom contact object attribute extensions.

section.t: Example of a <rdeContact:contact> element:

figure.artwork: ... <rdeContact:contents> ... <rdeContact:contact> <rdeContact:id>sh8013</rdeContact:id> <rdeContact:roid>Csh8013-TEST</rdeContact:roid> <rdeContact:status s="linked"/> <rdeContact:status s="clientDeleteProhibited"/> <rdeContact:postalInfo type="int"> <contact:name>John Doe</contact:name> <contact:org>Example Inc.</contact:org> <contact:addr> <contact:street>123 Example Dr.</contact:street> <contact:street>Suite 100</contact:street> <contact:city>Dulles</contact:city> <contact:sp>VA</contact:sp> <contact:pc>20166-6503</contact:pc> <contact:cc>US</contact:cc> </contact:addr> </rdeContact:postalInfo> <rdeContact:voice x="1234">+1.7035555555</rdeContact:voice> <rdeContact:fax>+1.7035555556</rdeContact:fax> <rdeContact:email>jdoe@example.test</rdeContact:email> <rdeContact:clID>clientY</rdeContact:clID> <rdeContact:crID>clientX</rdeContact:crID> <rdeContact:crDate>2009-09-13T08:01:00.0Z</rdeContact:crDate> <rdeContact:upID>clientX</rdeContact:upID> <rdeContact:upDate>2009-11-26T09:10:00.0Z</rdeContact:upDate> <rdeContact:authInfo> <contact:pw>2fooBAR</contact:pw> </rdeContact:authInfo> <rdeContact:disclose flag="0"> <contact:voice/> <contact:email/> </rdeContact:disclose> <rdeContact:transfer> <rdeContact:trStatus>pending</rdeContact:trStatus> <rdeContact:reID>clientW</rdeContact:reID> <rdeContact:reDate>2011-03-08T19:38:00.0Z</rdeContact:reDate> <rdeContact:acID>clientX</rdeContact:acID> <rdeContact:acDate>2011-03-13T23:59:59.0Z</rdeContact:acDate> </rdeContact:transfer> </rdeContact:contact> ... </rdeContact:contents> ...

section.title: <rdeContact:delete> object
section.t: The <rdeContact:delete> is contained under the <rde:deletes> element to define the list of contact objects that have been deleted in a differential (DIFF) or incremental (INCR) deposit. The <rdeContact:delete> element contains the following child elements:

list.t: Zero or more <rdeContact:id> elements that contain the server-unique identifier of the deleted contact objects.

section.t: Example of a <rdeContact:delete> element:

section.title: CSV Model
section.t: For the CSV Model of the contact object, the <rdeCsv:csv> and the <rdeCsv:csvDelete> elements, defined in the "<rdeCsv:csv> and <rdeCsv:csvDelete> elements" section, are used with the following supported "name" attribute values:

list.t: Defines the fields and CSV file references used for the contact object records. The following field elements were added for use in the "contact" <rdeCsv:csv> and <rdeCsv:csvDelete< rdeCsv:fields> elements:
Contains the server-unique contact identifier with type="eppcom:clIDType".
Contains the contact's voice telephone number with type="contact:e164StringType".
Contains the contact's voice telephone number extension with type="token".
Contains the contact's facsimile telephone number with type="contact:e164StringType".
Contains the contact's facsimile telephone number extension with type="token".
Contains the contact's email address with type="eppcom:minTokenType".
The following "rdeCsv" fields, defined in section CSV common field elements, MAY be used in the "contact" <rdeCsv:csv> <rdeCsv:fields> element:
<rdeCsv:fRoid>
<rdeCsv:fStatuses>
<rdeCsv:fClID>
<rdeCsv:fCrID>
<rdeCsv:fCrDate>
<rdeCsv:fUpID>
<rdeCsv:fUpDate>
<rdeCsv:fTrDate>
<rdeCsv:fPwAuthInfo>
Example of a "contact" <rdeCsv:csv> element:
Example of a "contact" <rdeCsv:csvDelete> element:

Defines the fields and CSV file references used for the contact postal info object records. The following field elements were added for use in the "contactPostal" <rdeCsv:csv> <rdeCsv:fields> element:

Contains the form of the postal-address information with type="contact:postalLineType". This field specifies the form ("int" or "loc"), as defined in , of the <rdeContact:fName>, <rdeContact:fOrg>, <rdeContact:fStreet>, <rdeContact:fCity>, <rdeContact:fSp>, <rdeContact:fPc>, <rdeContact:fCc> fields.

Contains the contact's name of the individual or role represented by the contact with type="contact:postalLineType". An OPTIONAL "isLoc" attribute to used to indicate the localized or internationalized form as defined in section .

Contains the name of the organization with which the contact is affiliated with type="contact:optPostalLineType". An OPTIONAL "isLoc" attribute to used to indicate the localized or internationalized form as defined in section .

Contains the contact's contact's street address line with type="contact:fPostalLineType". An index attribute is required to indicate which street address line the field represents with index "0" for the first line and index "2" for the last line. An OPTIONAL "isLoc" attribute to used to indicate the localized or internationalized form as defined in section .
Contains the contact's city with type="contact:postalLineType". An OPTIONAL "isLoc" attribute to used to indicate the localized or internationalized form as defined in section .
Contains the contact's state or province with type="contact:optPostalLineType". An OPTIONAL "isLoc" attribute to used to indicate the localized or internationalized form as defined in section .
Contains the contact's postal code with type="contact:pcType". An OPTIONAL "isLoc" attribute to used to indicate the localized or internationalized form as defined in section .
Contains the contact's country code with type="contact:ccType". An OPTIONAL "isLoc" attribute to used to indicate the localized or internationalized form as defined in section .
The following "rdeContact" fields, defined for the "contact" <rdeCsv:csv> <rdeCsv:fields> element, is used in the "contactPostal" <rdeCsv:csv> and <rdeCsv:csvDelete< rdeCsv:fields> elements:
<rdeContact:fId>
Example of a "contactPostal" <rdeCsv:csv> element:

figure.artwork: ... <rdeContact:contents> ... <rdeCsv:csv name="contactPostal"> <rdeCsv:sep>,</rdeCsv:sep> <rdeCsv:fields> <rdeContact:fId/> <rdeContact:fPostalType/> <rdeContact:fName/> <rdeContact:fOrg/> <rdeContact:fStreet index="0"/> <rdeContact:fStreet index="1"/> <rdeContact:fStreet index="2"/> <rdeContact:fCity/> <rdeContact:fSp/> <rdeContact:fPc/> <rdeContact:fCc/> </rdeCsv:fields> <rdeCsv:files> <rdeCsv:file cksum="2670296305 91797970"> contactPostal-YYYYMMDD.csv </rdeCsv:file> </rdeCsv:files> </rdeCsv:csv> ... </rdeContact:contents> ...

Defines the fields and CSV file references used for the contact disclose object records. The following field elements were added for use in the "contactDisclose" <rdeCsv:csv> <rdeCsv:fields> element:

Contains flag with a value of "true" or "1" (one) notes the preference to allow disclosure of the specified elements as an exception to the stated data-collection policy. A value of "false" or "0" (zero) notes a client preference to not allow disclosure of the specified elements as an exception to the stated data-collection policy with type="boolean". The additional fields define specific exceptional disclosure preferences based on the <rdeContact:fDiscloseFlag> field.
Exceptional disclosure preference flag for the localized form of the contact name with type="boolean".
Exceptional disclosure preference flag for the internationalized form of the contact name with type="boolean".
Exceptional disclosure preference flag for the localized form of the contact organization with type="boolean". with type="boolean".

section.title: Registrar Object
section.t: The registrar object represents the sponsoring client for other objects. The registrar object MAY be related to registrar contacts using Contact Object, as defined in , references using the <rdeRegistrar:contactObj> element or MAY contain registrar contacts using the <rdeRegistrar:contactAttr> element. The registrar object supports both the XML Model and the CSV Model, defined in . The elements used for both models are defined in the following sections. Both models use the <rdeRegistrar:contents> child element of the <rde:contents> element to hold the registrar objects for the deposit.

section.title: XML Model
section.t: There are two elements used in the data escrow of the registrar objects for the XML model including the <rdeRegistrar:registrar>, under the <rdeRegistrar:contents> element, and the <rdeRegistrar:delete> element, under the <rde:deletes> element.

section.title: <rdeRegistrar:registrar> element
section.t: The <rdeRegistrar:registrar> element reuses some concepts from the EPP Contact Mapping for the registrar object and registrar contact information. The <rdeRegistrar:registrar> element contains the following child elements:

list.t: Contains the server-unique identifier of the registrar object.
Contains the Repository Object IDentifier assigned to the registrar object when the object was created.

One or two <rdeRegistrar:name> elements that contain the name of the registrar. Two elements are provided so that name information can be provided in both internationlized and localized forms as defined in .
An OPTIONAL element that contains the ID assigned by ICANN.

The status of the registrar object. For extensibility the <rdeRegistrar:status> element includes an OPTIONAL "name" attribute that can define a sub-status or the full name of the status when the status value is "custom". The server SHOULD NOT use the "custom" status value. The <rdeRegistrar:status> element has one of the following values:
A normal status value for a registrar object.
A restricted status value for a registrar object.
A status for a registrar object that has no remaining access or privileges.
A custom status that is defined using the "name" attribute.

One or two <rdeRegistrar:addr> elements that contain the address informaton associated with the registrar object. Two elements are provided so that address information can be provided in both internationlized and localized forms as defined in . The <rdeRegistrar:addr> element contains the following child elements:
One, two, or three OPTIONAL <rdeRegistrar:street> elements that contain the registrar's street address.
Contains the registrar's city.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar's state or province.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar's postal code.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar's country code.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar's voice telephone number.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar's facsimile telephone number.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar's email address.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar's whois url.

Zero or more registrar contact object references or attributes. A contact object reference can be referenced by multiple objects while a contact attribute is defined only for that registrar. Either <rdeRegistrar:contactObject> or <rdeRegistrar:contactAttr MAY be used but both MUST NOT be used.
Zero or more OPTIONAL <rdeRegistrar:contactObj< elements that contain the contact identifiers and the contact types as defined in associated with the registrar object.
Zero or more OPTIONAL <rdeRegistrar:contactAttr< elements that contain the registrar contact information. The <rdeRegistrar:contactAttr> element contains the following child elements:
Contains the server-unique identifier of the registrar contact object.
Contains the Repository Object IDentifier assigned to the registrar contact object when the object was created.

One or two <rdeRegistrar:name> elements that contain the name of the registrar contact object. Two elements are provided so that the name information can be provided in both internationalized and localized forms as defined in .

One to three <rdeRegistrar:type> elements that contain the registrar contact type. A Registrar contact object MAY be assigned more than one registrar contact type. The possible registrar contact type values include:
Administration registrar contact type.
Technical registrar contact type.
Billing registrar contact type.

One or two <rdeRegistrar:addr> elements that contains the address information associated with the registrar contact object. Two elements are provided so that the adddress information can be provided in both internationalized and localized forms as defined in . <rdeRegistrar:addr> element contains the following child elements:
One, two, or three OPTIONAL <rdeRegistrar:street> elements that contain the registrar contact's street address.
Contains the registrar contact's city.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar contact's state or province.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar contact's postal code.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar contact's country code.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar contact's voice telephone number.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar contact's facsimile telephone number.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar contact's email address.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the identifier of the client that created the registrar contact object.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of registrar contact object creation.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of the most recent registrar contact object modification.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of the most recent registrar contact object modification.
An OPTIONAL element containing the custom registrar contact object attribute extensions.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the registrar's web url.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the identifier of the client that created the registrar object.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of registrar object creation.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the identifier of the client that last updated the registrar object.
An OPTIONAL element that contains the date and time of the most recent registrar object modification.
An OPTIONAL element containing the custom registrar object attribute extensions.

section.t: Example of a <rdeRegistrar:registrar> element using <rdeRegistrar:contactObj> elements:

figure.artwork: ... <rdeRegistrar:contents> ... <rdeRegistrar:registrar> <rdeRegistrar:id>EXAMPLE</rdeRegistrar:id> <rdeRegistrar:roid>REGISTRAR1234-TEST</rdeRegistrar:roid> <rdeRegistrar:name type="int">Example Inc.</rdeRegistrar:name> <rdeRegistrar:icannId>1234</rdeRegistrar:icannId> <rdeRegistrar:status>ok</rdeRegistrar:status> <rdeRegistrar:addr type="int"> <rdeRegistrar:street>123 Example Dr.</rdeRegistrar:street> <rdeRegistrar:street>Suite 100</rdeRegistrar:street> <rdeRegistrar:city>Dulles</rdeRegistrar:city> <rdeRegistrar:sp>VA</rdeRegistrar:sp> <rdeRegistrar:pc>20166-6503</rdeRegistrar:pc> <rdeRegistrar:cc>US</rdeRegistrar:cc> </rdeRegistrar:addr> <rdeRegistrar:voice x="1234">+1.7035555555 </rdeRegistrar:voice> <rdeRegistrar:fax>+1.7035555556</rdeRegistrar:fax> <rdeRegistrar:email>jdoe@example.test </rdeRegistrar:email> <rdeRegistrar:url>http://www.example.test </rdeRegistrar:url> <rdeRegistrar:whoisUrl>http://whois.example.test </rdeRegistrar:whoisUrl> <rdeRegistrar:contactObj type="admin">rr0013 </rdeRegistrar:contactObj> <rdeRegistrar:contactObj type="tech">rr0012 </rdeRegistrar:contactObj> <rdeRegistrar:crID>clientX</rdeRegistrar:crID> <rdeRegistrar:crDate>2005-04-23T11:49:00.0Z </rdeRegistrar:crDate> <rdeRegistrar:upID>clientY</rdeRegistrar:upID> <rdeRegistrar:upDate>2009-02-17T17:51:00.0Z </rdeRegistrar:upDate> </rdeRegistrar:registrar> ... </rdeRegistrar:contents> ...

type="int">Example 2 Inc.</rdeRegistrar:name> <rdeRegistrar:icannId>21234</rdeRegistrar:icannId> <rdeRegistrar:status>ok</rdeRegistrar:status> <rdeRegistrar:addr type="int"> <rdeRegistrar:street>123 <rdeRegistrar:email>jdoe@example.test</rdeRegistrar:email> </rdeRegistrar:contactAttr> <rdeRegistrar:crID>clientX</rdeRegistrar:crID> <rdeRegistrar:crDate>2005-04-23T11:49:00.0Z</rdeRegistrar:crDate> <rdeRegistrar:upID>clientY</rdeRegistrar:upID> <rdeRegistrar:upDate>2009-02-17T17:51:00.0Z</rdeRegistrar:upDate> </rdeRegistrar:registrar> ... </rdeRegistrar:contents> ...

section.title: <rdeRegistrar:delete> object
section.t: The <rdeRegistrar:delete> is contained under the <rde:deletes> element to define the list of registrar objects that have been deleted in a differential (DIFF) or incremental (INCR) deposit. The <rdeRegistrar:delete> element contains the following child elements:

list.t: Zero or more <rdeRegistrar:id> elements that contain the server-unique identifier of the deleted registrar objects.

section.t: Example of a <rdeRegistrar:delete> element:

section.title: CSV Model
section.t: For the CSV Model of the registrar object, the <rdeCsv:csv> and the <rdeCsv:csvDelete> elements, defined in the "<rdeCsv:csv> and <rdeCsv:csvDelete> elements" section, are used with the following supported "name" attribute values:

list.t: Defines the fields and CSV file references used for the registrar object records. The following field elements were added for use in the "registrar" <rdeCsv:csv> and <rdeCsv:csvDelete< rdeCsv:fields> elements:
Contains the server-unique registrar identifier with type="eppcom:clIDType".
Contains the name of the registrar with type="normalizedString".
Contains the ID assigned by ICANN with type="positiveInteger".
Contains the status of the registrar with type="rdeRegistrar:statusValueType".
Contains the name of the registrar sub-status or the full name of the status when the fStatus value is "custom" with type="token".
Contains the URL of the registrar with type="anyURI".
Contains the Whois URL of the registrar with type="anyURI".
The following "rdeCsv" fields, defined in section CSV common field elements, MAY be used in the "registrar" <rdeCsv:csv> <rdeCsv:fields> element:

section.title: IDN Language Rules Object
section.t: The IDN domain names, defined in , MAY have references to the applicable IDN language rules using the language as a lookup key with the <rdeDomain:language> element in the XML model or the <rdeDomain:fLanguage> field element in the CSV model. The language rules are logical expressions that reference external URL's for the detailed character code points. Multiple <rdeDomain:language> or <rdeDomain:fLanguage> values can share the same IDN language rule. The IDN Language Rules only supports the XML model, since the definition of the language rules does not work well with the CSV model and the amount of data is relatively small.

There are two elements used in the data escrow of the IDN language rule objects including the <rdeIDN:languageRules>, under the <rdeIDN:contents> element, and the <rdeIDN:delete> element, under the <rde:deletes> element.

section.title: <rdeIDN:languageRules> element
section.t: The <rdeIDN:languageRules> element defines the language rules for a set of languages referenced from by the <rdeDomain:language> element or the <rdeDomain:fLanguage> field element using a logical expression. The logical expression defines the language tables, with an external URL reference per language table, that apply to the set of languages. There are two options in selecting the language tables. The first option is when the character code points of the domain name MUST fall into only one of the language tables with the use="one" attribute value. The second option is when the character code points of the domain name MAY fall into any one of the language tables using the use="all" attribute value. Each entry in the list of language tables can be a list with a different "use" attribute value, resulting in a recursive structure. The <rdeIDN:languageRules> element contains the following child elements:

list.t: One or more <rdeIDN:language> elements representing the language that the rules applies to. The <rdeIDN:language> element values MUST reside in a single <rdeIDN:languageRules> element so that there is no conflict. The <rdeDomain:language> element and the <rdeDomain:fLanguage> field element, defined in MUST match one and only one <rdeIDN:language> element in the set of <rdeIDN:languageRules>

One or more <rdeIDN:table> element that define the set of language tables that the domain name character code points can fall in. The "use" attribute has two different values including "one" and "all". The "one" value specifies that the domain name character code points can only fall in one of the child language table rule elements. The "all" value specifies that the domain name code points can fall in any one of the child language table rule elements. The <rdeIDN:table> element contains the following child elements:
Zero or more <rdeIDN:url> elements that reference language table contain the applicable character code points.
Zero or more <rdeIDN:table> elements that reference an additional language table rule expression recursively.

section.t: Example of a <rdeIDN:contents> element with two language rules across three languages.

section.title: <rdeIDN:delete> object
section.t: The <rdeIDN:delete> is contained under the <rde:deletes> element to define the list of language rules objects that have been deleted in a differential (DIFF) or incremental (INCR) deposit. The <rdeIDN:delete> element contains the following child elements:

list.t: Zero or more <rdeIDN:language> elements that contain language defined within an existing language rule. Once all of the languages have been removed from a language rule, the language rule itself MUST be deleted. Any domain name <rdeDomain:language> element or <rdeDomain;fLanguage> field element references to the <rdeIDN:language> being deleted MUST be updated to a different language.

section.t: Example of a <rdeIDN:delete> element:

section.title: EPP Parameters Object
section.t: The OPTIONAL EPP Parameters Object defines the set of object and object extension services supported by the registry, as defined in . The EPP Parameters Object only supports the XML model and is defined using the <rdeEppParams:contents> element with the <rdeEppParams:eppParams> child element. The EPP Parameters Object SHOULD be included if the registry uses EPP.
The syntax and content of the <rdeEppParams:eppParams> children elements is as explained in section 2.4 of . The children of the <rdeEppParams:eppParams> are as follows:

list.t: One or more <version> elements that indicate the EPP versions supported by the registry.
One or more <lang> elements that indicate the identifiers of the text response languages supported by the registry's EPP server.
One or more <objURI> elements that contain namespace URIs representing the objects that the registry's EPP server is capable of managing.
An OPTIONAL <svcExtension> element that contains one or more <extURI> elements that contain namespace URIs representing object extensions supported by the registry's EPP server.
A <dcp> element that contains child elements used to describe the server's privacy policy for data collection and management. See section 2.4 of for more details.

section.t: Example of <eppParams> element object:

section.title: Formal Syntax
section.t: Seven schemas are presented here. The first schema is the base RDE schema. The second schema defines domain name object for RDE. The third schema defines host object for RDE. The fourth schema defines contact object for RDE. The fifth schema defines registrar object for RDE. The sixth schema defines the idnTableRef and IDN objects. The last schema defines the eppParams objects.

figure.artwork:
BEGIN <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<schema targetNamespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeCsv-1.0" xmlns:rdeCsv="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeCsv-1.0" xmlns:rde="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rde-1.0" xmlns:eppcom="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:eppcom-1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" elementFormDefault="qualified">
<!-- Import common element types --> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:eppcom-1.0" schemaLocation="eppcom-1.0.xsd"/> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rde-1.0" schemaLocation="rde-1.0.xsd"/>
<annotation> <documentation> Registry Data Escrow Comma-Seperated Values (CSV) </documentation> </annotation>
<!-- csv content element --> <element name="csv" type="rdeCsv:csvType" substitutionGroup="rde:content"/>
<!-- Definition of CSV file --> <complexType name="csvType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rde:contentType"> <sequence> <element name="sep" type="token" default="," minOccurs="0"/> <element name="fields" type="rdeCsv:fieldsType"/> <element name="files" type="rdeCsv:filesType"/> </sequence> <attribute name="name" type="token" use="required"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<element name="csvDelete" type="rdeCsv:csvDeleteType" substitutionGroup="rde:delete"/>
<complexType name="csvDeleteType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rde:deleteType"> <sequence> <element name="sep" type="token" default="," minOccurs="0"/> <element name="fields" type="rdeCsv:fieldsType"/> <element name="files" type="rdeCsv:filesType"/> </sequence> <attribute name="name" type="token" use="required"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Abstract field type --> <element name="field" type="rdeCsv:fieldType" abstract="true"/> <complexType name="fieldType"> <sequence/> </complexType>
<!-- Concrete field types -->
<!-- Name field (e.g. domain name) --> <element name="fName" type="rdeCsv:fNameType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- UTF-8 Name field (e.g. domain name) --> <element name="fUName" type="rdeCsv:fNameType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fNameType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="eppcom\:labelType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Registry Object IDentifier (roid) field --> <element name="fRoid" type="rdeCsv:fRoidType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fRoidType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="eppcom\:roidType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Registrant field --> <element name="fRegistrant" type="rdeCsv:fRegistrantType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fRegistrantType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="eppcom\:clIDType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Contact fields (Admin, Tech, Billing) --> <element name="fAdminContacts" type="rdeCsv:fContactsType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <element name="fTechContacts" type="rdeCsv:fContactsType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <element name="fBillingContacts" type="rdeCsv:fContactsType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fContactsType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="eppcom\:clIDType"/> <attribute name="list" type="boolean" default="true"/> <attribute name="sep" type="token" default=","/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Statuses as a list of delimited statuses with ',' as delimeter --> <element name="fStatuses" type="rdeCsv:fStatusesType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fStatusesType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="eppcom\:statusType"/> <attribute name="list" type="boolean" default="true"/> <attribute name="sep" type="token" default=","/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- clID fields (fClID, fCrID, fUpID) --> <!-- Identifier of client that sponsors the object --> <element name="fClID" type="rdeCsv:fClIDType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Identifier of client that created the object --> <element name="fCrID" type="rdeCsv:fClIDType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Identifier of client that updated the object --> <element name="fUpID" type="rdeCsv:fClIDType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Identifier of client that requested the transfer --> <element name="fReID" type="rdeCsv:fClIDType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Identifier of client that should take or took action --> <element name="fAcID" type="rdeCsv:fClIDType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fClIDType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="eppcom\:clIDType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- datetime fields (fCrDate, fUpDate, fExDate) --> <element name="fCrDate" type="rdeCsv:fDatetimeType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <element name="fUpDate" type="rdeCsv:fDatetimeType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <element name="fExDate" type="rdeCsv:fDatetimeType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Date and time that transfer was requested --> <element name="fReDate" type="rdeCsv:fDatetimeType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Date and time of a required or completed response --> <element name="fAcDate" type="rdeCsv:fDatetimeType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <element name="fTrDate" type="rdeCsv:fDatetimeType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fDatetimeType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="datetime"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- boolean type --> <complexType name="fBooleanType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="boolean"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- unsignedbyte type --> <complexType name="fUnsignedByteType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="unsignedbyte"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- unsignedShort type --> <complexType name="fUnsignedShortType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="unsignedShort"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- hexBinary type --> <complexType name="fHexBinaryType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="hexBinary"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- language type --> <element name="fLanguage" type="rdeCsv:fLanguageType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fLanguageType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="language"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- State of the most recent transfer request --> <element name="fTrStatus" type="rdeCsv:fTrStatusType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fTrStatusType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="eppcom\:trStatusType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- General token type --> <complexType name="fTokenType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="token"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- positive integer type --> <complexType name="fPositiveIntegerType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="positiveInteger"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Password authorization info --> <element name="fPwAuthInfo" type="rdeCsv:fPwAuthInfoType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fPwAuthInfoType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="normalizedString"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Custom / extension field type --> <element name="fCustom" type="rdeCsv:fCustomType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fCustomType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="name" type="token"/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="token"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Ordered list of field definitions for the csv --> <complexType name="fieldsType"> <sequence maxOccurs="unbounded"> <element ref="rdeCsv:field"/> </sequence> </complexType>
<!-- List of files --> <complexType name="filesType"> <sequence> <element name="file" type="rdeCsv:fileType" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </complexType>
<!-- File definition --> <complexType name="fileType"> <simpleContent> <extension base="token"> <attribute name="compression" type="token"/> <attribute name="encoding" type="token" default="UTF-8"/> <attribute name="cksum" type="token"/> </extension> </simpleContent> </complexType>
<!-- End of schema. --> </schema> END

BEGIN <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<schema targetNamespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeDomain-1.0" xmlns:rdeDomain="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeDomain-1.0" xmlns:rde="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rde-1.0" xmlns:rdeCsv="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeCsv-1.0" xmlns:rgp="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rgp-1.0" xmlns:secDNS="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:secDNS-1.1" xmlns:domain="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:domain-1.0" xmlns:eppcom="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:eppcom-1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" elementFormDefault="qualified">
<!-- Import common element types --> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:eppcom-1.0" schemaLocation="eppcom-1.0.xsd"/> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:domain-1.0" schemaLocation="domain-1.0.xsd"/> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:secDNS-1.1" schemaLocation="secDNS-1.1.xsd"/> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rgp-1.0" schemaLocation="rgp-1.0.xsd"/> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rde-1.0" schemaLocation="rde-1.0.xsd"/> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeCsv-1.0" schemaLocation="rdeCsv-1.0.xsd"/>
<annotation> <documentation> Registry Data Escrow (RDE) Domain Object </documentation> </annotation>
<!-- Child elements of the <rde:contents> object --> <element name="contents" type="rdeDomain:contentsType" substitutionGroup="rde:contents"/>
<complexType name="contentsType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rde:contentsType"/> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Child elements of the <rde:contents> object --> <!-- domain content element for XML model --> <element name="domain" type="rdeDomain:contentType" substitutionGroup="rde:content"/>
<!-- Domain content type for XML model --> <complexType name="contentType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rde:contentType"> <sequence> <element name="name" type="eppcom:labelType"/> <element name="uName" type="eppcom:labelType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="roid" type="eppcom:roidType"/> <element name="idn" type="boolean" minOccurs="0" default="false"/> <element name="language" type="language" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="variant" type="boolean" minOccurs="0" default="false"/> <element name="originalName" type="eppcom:labelType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="reserved" type="boolean" minOccurs="0" default="false"/> <element name="status" type="domain:statusType" maxOccurs="11"/> <element name="rgpStatus" type="rgp:statusType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="registrant" type="eppcom:clIDType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="contact" type="domain:contactType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <element name="ns" type="domain:nsType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="host" type="eppcom:labelType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <element name="clID" type="eppcom:clIDType"/> <element name="crID" type="eppcom:clIDType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="crDate" type="dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="exDate" type="dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="upID" type="eppcom:clIDType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="upDate" type="dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="trDate" type="dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="authInfo" type="domain:authInfoType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="dnssec" type="secDNS:dsOrKeyType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="transfer" type="rdeDomain:transferDataType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <element name="extension" type="rde:extAnyType" minOccurs="0"/> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Domain transfer information for XML model --> <complexType name="transferDataType"> <sequence> <element name="trStatus" type="eppcom:trStatusType"/> <element name="reID" type="eppcom:clIDType"/> <element name="reDate" type="dateTime"/> <element name="acID" type="eppcom:clIDType"/> <element name="acDate" type="dateTime"/> <element name="exDate" type="dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> </sequence> </complexType>
<!-- RGP statuses field --> <element name="fRgpStatuses" type="rdeDomain:fRgpStatusesType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fRgpStatusesType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="rgp\:statusType"/> <attribute name="list" type="boolean" default="true"/> <attribute name="sep" type="token" default=","/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Name server object list field --> <element name="fNsObjs" type="rdeDomain:fNsObjsType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fNsObjsType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="eppcom\:labelType"/> <attribute name="list" type="boolean" default="true"/> <attribute name="sep" type="token" default=","/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- DNSSEC field types -->
<!-- Maximum signature lifetime field --> <element name="fMaxSigLife" type="rdeDomain:fMaxSigLifeType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fMaxSigLifeType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="secDNS\:maxSigLifeType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Key tag field --> <element name="fKeyTag" type="rdeCsv:fUnsignedShortType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- DS Algorithm field --> <element name="fDsAlg" type="rdeCsv:fUnsignedByteType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Digest type field --> <element name="fDigestType" type="rdeCsv:fUnsignedByteType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Digest field --> <element name="fDigest" type="rdeCsv:fHexBinaryType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Flags field --> <element name="fFlags" type="rdeCsv:fUnsignedShortType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Protocol field --> <element name="fProtocol" type="rdeCsv:fUnsignedByteType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Key Algorithm field --> <element name="fKeyAlg" type="rdeCsv:fUnsignedByteType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Public Key field --> <element name="fPubKey" type="rdeDomain:fPubKeyType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fPubKeyType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="secDNS\:keyType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Boolean type fields --> <element name="fIdn" type="rdeCsv:fBooleanType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <element name="fVariant" type="rdeCsv:fBooleanType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <element name="fReserved" type="rdeCsv:fBooleanType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Original Domain Name for Variant field --> <element name="fOriginalName" type="rdeCsv:fNameType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Child elements of the <rde:delete> object --> <element name="delete" type="rdeDomain:deleteType" substitutionGroup="rde:delete"/>
<complexType name="deleteType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rde:deleteType"> <sequence> <element name="name" type="eppcom:labelType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- End of schema. --> </schema> END

BEGIN <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<schema targetNamespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeHost-1.0" xmlns:rdeHost="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeHost-1.0" xmlns:rde="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rde-1.0" xmlns:rdeCsv="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeCsv-1.0" xmlns:host="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:host-1.0" xmlns:eppcom="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:eppcom-1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" elementFormDefault="qualified">
<!-- Import common element types --> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:eppcom-1.0" schemaLocation="eppcom-1.0.xsd"/> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:host-1.0" schemaLocation="host-1.0.xsd"/> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rde-1.0" schemaLocation="rde-1.0.xsd"/> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeCsv-1.0" schemaLocation="rdeCsv-1.0.xsd"/>
<annotation> <documentation> Registry Data Escrow (RDE) Host Object </documentation> </annotation>
<!-- Child elements of the <rde:contents> object --> <element name="contents" type="rdeHost:contentsType" substitutionGroup="rde:contents"/>
<complexType name="contentsType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rde:contentsType"/> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Child elements of the <rde:content> object --> <!-- host content element for XML model--> <element name="host" type="rdeHost:contentType" substitutionGroup="rde:content"/>
<!-- Host content type for XML model --> <complexType name="contentType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rde:contentType"> <sequence> <element name="name" type="eppcom:labelType"/> <element name="uName" type="eppcom:labelType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="parentDomain" type="eppcom:labelType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="roid" type="eppcom:roidType"/> <element name="idn" type="boolean" minOccurs="0" default="false"/> <element name="status" type="host:statusType" maxOccurs="7"/> <element name="addr" type="host:addrType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <element name="clID" type="eppcom:clIDType"/> <element name="crID" type="eppcom:clIDType"/> <element name="crDate" type="dateTime"/> <element name="upID" type="eppcom:clIDType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="upDate" type="dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="trDate" type="dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="extension" type="rde:extAnyType" minOccurs="0"/> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- IP address fields (fV4Addrs, fV6Addrs) --> <element name="fV4Addrs" type="rdeHost:fAddrsType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <element name="fV6Addrs" type="rdeHost:fAddrsType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fAddrsType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="host\:addrStringType"/> <attribute name="list" type="boolean" default="true"/> <attribute name="sep" type="token" default=","/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Boolean type fields --> <element name="fIdn" type="rdeCsv:fBooleanType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Parent domain name for subordinate host field --> <element name="fParentDomain" type="rdeCsv:fNameType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Child elements of the <rde:delete> object --> <element name="delete" type="rdeHost:deleteType" substitutionGroup="rde:delete"/>
<complexType name="deleteType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rde:deleteType"> <sequence> <element name="name" type="eppcom:labelType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- End of schema. --> </schema> END

BEGIN <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<schema targetNamespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeContact-1.0" xmlns:rdeContact="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeContact-1.0" xmlns:rde="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rde-1.0" xmlns:rdeCsv="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeCsv-1.0" xmlns:contact="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:contact-1.0" xmlns:eppcom="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:eppcom-1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" elementFormDefault="qualified">
<!-- Import common element types. --> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:eppcom-1.0" schemaLocation="eppcom-1.0.xsd"/> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:contact-1.0" schemaLocation="contact-1.0.xsd"/> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rde-1.0" schemaLocation="rde-1.0.xsd"/> <import namespace="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:rdeCsv-1.0" schemaLocation="rdeCsv-1.0.xsd"/>
<annotation> <documentation> Registry Data Escrow (RDE) Contact Object </documentation> </annotation>
<!-- Child elements of the <rde:contents> object --> <element name="contents" type="rdeContact:contentsType" substitutionGroup="rde:contents"/>
<complexType name="contentsType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rde:contentsType"/> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Child elements of the <rde:content> object --> <!-- contact content element for XML model --> <element name="contact" type="rdeContact:contentType" substitutionGroup="rde:content"/>
<!-- Contact content type for XML model --> <complexType name="contentType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rde:contentType"> <sequence> <element name="id" type="eppcom:clIDType"/> <element name="roid" type="eppcom:roidType"/> <element name="status" type="contact:statusType" maxOccurs="7"/> <element name="postalInfo" type="contact:postalInfoType" maxOccurs="2"/> <element name="voice" type="contact:e164Type" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="fax" type="contact:e164Type" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="email" type="eppcom:minTokenType"/> <element name="clID" type="eppcom:clIDType"/> <element name="crID" type="eppcom:clIDType"/> <element name="crDate" type="dateTime"/> <element name="upID" type="eppcom:clIDType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="upDate" type="dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="trDate" type="dateTime" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="authInfo" type="contact:authInfoType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="disclose" type="contact:discloseType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="transfer" type="rdeContact:transferDataType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="extension" type="rde:extAnyType" minOccurs="0"/> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<complexType name="transferDataType"> <sequence> <element name="trStatus" type="eppcom:trStatusType"/> <element name="reID" type="eppcom:clIDType"/> <element name="reDate" type="dateTime"/> <element name="acID" type="eppcom:clIDType"/> <element name="acDate" type="dateTime"/> </sequence> </complexType>
<!-- Server-unique contact identifier field --> <element name="fId" type="rdeContact:fIdType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fIdType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="eppcom\:clIDType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- voice and fax telephone number fields --> <element name="fVoice" type="rdeContact:fE164StringType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <element name="fFax" type="rdeContact:fE164StringType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fE164StringType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="contact\:e164StringType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- voice and fax telephone extension fields --> <element name="fVoiceExt" type="rdeCsv:fTokenType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <element name="fFaxExt" type="rdeCsv:fTokenType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- contact email address field --> <element name="fEmail" type="rdeContact:fEmailType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fEmailType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="eppcom\:minTokenType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Postal type field ("loc" = localized, "int" = internationalized) --> <element name="fPostalType" type="rdeContact:fPostalTypeType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fPostalTypeType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="contact\:postalInfoEnumType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Standard postal line field --> <complexType name="fPostalLineType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="contact\:postalLineType"/> <attribute name="postalType" type="contact:postalInfoEnumType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Standard optional postal line field --> <complexType name="fOptPostalLineType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="contact\:optPostalLineType"/> <attribute name="postalType" type="contact:postalInfoEnumType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Name of the individual or role field --> <element name="fName" type="rdeContact:fPostalLineType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Name organization field --> <element name="fOrg" type="rdeContact:fOptPostalLineType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Street address line field with required index attribute --> <!-- starting with index 0. --> <element name="fStreet" type="rdeContact:fStreetType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fStreetType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeContact:fPostalLineType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="index" type="int" use="required"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Contact's city field --> <element name="fCity" type="rdeContact:fPostalLineType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Contact's state or province field --> <element name="fSp" type="rdeContact:fOptPostalLineType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/>
<!-- Contact's postal code field --> <element name="fPc" type="rdeContact:fPcType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fPcType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="contact\:pcType"/> <attribute name="postalType" type="contact:postalInfoEnumType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Contact's country code field --> <element name="fCc" type="rdeContact:fCcType" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fCcType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="contact\:ccType"/> <attribute name="postalType" type="contact:postalInfoEnumType"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Disclosure element fields --> <!-- Flag of "1" to allow disclosure and "0" to disallow disclosure --> <element name="fDiscloseFlag" type="rdeContact:fBoolean" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Disclosure of localized name based on fDiscloseFlag? --> <element name="fDiscloseNameLoc" type="rdeContact:fBoolean" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Disclosure of internationalized name based on fDiscloseFlag? --> <element name="fDiscloseNameInt" type="rdeContact:fBoolean" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Disclosure of localized org based on fDiscloseFlag? --> <element name="fDiscloseOrgLoc" type="rdeContact:fBoolean" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Disclosure of internationalized org based on fDiscloseFlag? --> <element name="fDiscloseOrgInt" type="rdeContact:fBoolean" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Disclosure of localized address based on fDiscloseFlag? --> <element name="fDiscloseAddrLoc" type="rdeContact:fBoolean" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Disclosure of internationalized address based on fDiscloseFlag? --> <element name="fDiscloseAddrInt" type="rdeContact:fBoolean" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Disclosure voice telephone number based on fDiscloseFlag? --> <element name="fDiscloseVoice" type="rdeContact:fBoolean" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Disclosure facsimile telephone number based on fDiscloseFlag? --> <element name="fDiscloseFax" type="rdeContact:fBoolean" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <!-- Disclosure email address based on fDiscloseFlag? --> <element name="fDiscloseEmail" type="rdeContact:fBoolean" substitutionGroup="rdeCsv:field"/> <complexType name="fBoolean"> <complexContent> <extension base="rdeCsv:fieldType"> <sequence/> <attribute name="type" type="token" default="boolean"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- Child elements of the <rde:delete> object --> <element name="delete" type="rdeContact:deleteType" substitutionGroup="rde:delete"/>
<complexType name="deleteType"> <complexContent> <extension base="rde:deleteType"> <sequence> <element name="id" type="eppcom:clIDType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType>
<!-- End of schema. --> </schema> END
